en: Now concerning spiritual gifts, brethren, I would not have you ignorant.
hmr: Chun, unauhai, thlarau tieng thilpêk thuhai chu in hriet naw ka nuom nawh.

en: Ye know that when ye were Gentiles ye were led away unto those dumb idols, howsoever ye might be led.
hmr: Awinawhai in ni lai khan, ieng ang khawma an ṭhuoi ang pei cheu khan, khâng milim rawl neilo tienga khan ṭhuoihmangin in um ti in hriet a.

en: Wherefore I make known unto you, that no man speaking in the Spirit of God saith, Jesus is anathema; and no man can say, Jesus is Lord, but in the Holy Spirit.
hmr: Chuleiin, tûkhawmin Pathien thlaraua thu hrilin, “Isu chu ṭawng- sephur a nih,” an ti ngai nawh; chun, tûkhawmin Thlarau Inthienga chau naw chun, “Isu chu Lalpa a nih,” an ti thei ngai nawh ti kân hriettir cheu.

en: Now there are diversities of gifts, but the same Spirit.
hmr: Chun, thilpêk chu a tum tum a um a, Thlarau chu hmunkhat a nih.

en: And there are diversities of ministrations, and the same Lord.
hmr: Rawngbâwl dân tum tum khawm a um a; nisienlakhawm, Lalpa chu hmunkhat a nih.

en: And there are diversities of workings, but the same God, who worketh all things in all.
hmr: Sinthaw dân tum tum khawm a um a, Pathien ruok chu hmunkhat a nih, mi po poa iengkim thawtu chu.

en: But to each one is given the manifestation of the Spirit to profit withal.
hmr: Chun, ṭhathnempui tlâng seng dingin Thlarau inhriettirna chu mi tin kuomah pêk seng a nih.

en: For to one is given through the Spirit the word of wisdom; and to another the word of knowledge, according to the same Spirit:
hmr: Mi pakhat kuomah Thlaraua chun varna thu pêk a nih; mi dang kuomah chu Thlarau thu ma chun hrietna pêk a nih;

en: to another faith, in the same Spirit; and to another gifts of healings, in the one Spirit;
hmr: chun, mi dang kuomah chu Thlaraua bawk chun, ringna pêk a nih; mi dang kuomah Thlarau thuhmuna chun sukdam theina pêk a nih;

en: and to another workings of miracles; and to another prophecy; and to another discernings of spirits: to another divers kinds of tongues; and to another the interpretation of tongues:
hmr: mi dang kuomah thilmak thaw- theina pêk a nih; mi dang kuomah thuhril theina pêk a nih; mi dang kuomah thlarauhai hriet dik theina pêk a nih; chun, mi dang kuomah ṭawng hrietlo chi dang danghaia thuhril theina pêk a nih; mi dang kuomah ṭawng hrietlohai hrilfie theina pêk a ni sih a;

en: but all these worketh the one and the same Spirit, dividing to each one severally even as he will.
hmr: nisienlakhawm, chuong po po chu Thlarau thuhmun bawk chun, mi tin kuomah a nuom ang peia semin sin a thaw hlak.

en: For as the body is one, and hath many members, and all the members of the body, being many, are one body; so also is Christ.
hmr: Taksa hi pakhat a na, pêng tamtak a nei a, taksa pênghai po po chu tam hai sienkhawm taksa pum- khat an ni sih a; Krista chu chuong ang bawk chu a nih.

en: For in one Spirit were we all baptized into one body, whether Jews or Greeks, whether bond or free; and were all made to drink of one Spirit.
hmr: Ei rêngin, Judahai amanih, Grikhai amanih, suok amanih, suok nilo amanih taksa pumkhata um dingin, Thlarau pakhat chauah bap- tisin ei um seng sih a. Thlarau pakhat chau bawk a mîn dâwntir bawk a.

en: For the body is not one member, but many.
hmr: Taksa hi pêng khat chau a ni si nawh a, pêng tamtak a ni lem.

en: If the foot shall say, Because I am not the hand, I am not of the body; it is not therefore not of the body.
hmr: Kepha hin, “Kut ka ni naw leiin taksaa ṭhang ka ni nawh,” ti sienla, chu lei chun taksaa ṭhang naw a ni chuong nawh.

en: And if the ear shall say, Because I am not the eye, I am not of the body; it is not therefore not of the body.
hmr: Chun, nakâwr hin, “Mit ka ni naw leiin taksaa ṭhang ka ni nawh” ti sienla, chu lei chun taksaa ṭhang naw a ni chuong nawh.

en: If the whole body were an eye, where were the hearing? If the whole were hearing, where were the smelling?
hmr: Taksa pumpui hi mit ni vawng ta sienla, ri hrietna chu khâwlai am ni tâng a ti leh? A pumin ri hrietna ni vawng ta sienla, rim hriet theina chu khâwlai am ni tâng a ti leh?

en: But now hath God set the members each one of them in the body, even as it pleased him.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, Pathienin pêng tin hi taksaah a nuomna poah ân umtir seng tah a nih.

en: And if they were all one member, where were the body?
hmr: Chuongchun, chuong po po chu pêng khat chau ni sienla, taksa hi khâwlai am um a ta?

en: But now they are many members, but one body.
hmr: Amiruokchu, pêng tamtak an ni lem a; nisienlakhawm, taksa pum- khat chau a ni sih a.

en: And the eye cannot say to the hand, I have no need of thee: or again the head to the feet, I have no need of you.
hmr: Chun, mit hin kut kuomah, “Ienga khawm hmangna ka nei naw che,” a ti thei nawh; lu khawm hin kephahai kuomah, “Ienga khawm hmangna ka nei naw cheu,” a ti thei bawk nawh.

en: Nay, much rather, those members of the body which seem to be more feeble are necessary:
hmr: Anih, chuong nêk hmanin taksa pêng hrât âwm loa inlanghai hi an pawimaw lem bêk bêk a nih;

en: and those parts of the body, which we think to be less honorable, upon these we bestow more abundant honor; and our uncomely parts have more abundant comeliness;
hmr: chuongchun, taksa pêng chawi- mawi tlâk naw lema ei ruothai hi, chuong ngei chu ei chawimawi nasa lem hlak; chuongchun, ei pêng mawinawhai hin mawina nasa lem an hmu hlak;

en: whereas our comely parts have no need: but God tempered the body together, giving more abundant honor to that part which lacked;
hmr: ei pêng mawi lemhai ruok chun chuong anga thaw chu an ngai nawh; nisienlakhawm, Pathienin mawina neinaw pêng chu chawimawi nasa lemin taksa hi a rem khâwm a nih;

en: that there should be no schism in the body; but that the members should have the same care one for another.
hmr: taksaa hin inṭhena hrim um loa, pênghai hin inangtaka an inbuoipui tuo seng theina dingin.

en: And whether one member suffereth, all the members suffer with it; or one member is honored, all the members rejoice with it.
hmr: Chuongchun, pêng khatin a tuor chun, pêng po poin an tuorpui hlak, pêng khat chawimawia a um chun, pêng po poin an lâwmpui hlak.

en: Now ye are the body of Christ, and severally members thereof.
hmr: Chuongchun, nangnirawi hi Krista taksa chu in nih, a pênghai in ni seng bawk a.

en: And God hath set some in the church, first apostles, secondly prophets, thirdly teachers, then miracles, then gifts of healings, helps, governments, divers kinds of tongues.
hmr: Chun, Pathienin ṭhenkhat chu kohran lai a sieh a, pakhatnaa chun tirkohai, a pahninaa chun thuhriltu- hai, a pathumnaa chun inchûktir- tuhai a sie a, chu hnunga chun thilmak thawhai an um a, chu zoa chun sukdam theina thilpêkhai, ṭhangpui theina thilpêkhai, rorêl thiemna thilpêkhai, ṭawng hrietlo chi tum tuma thuhril theina thilpêkhai a um nâwk a.

en: Are all apostles? are all prophets? are all teachers? are all workers of miracles?
hmr: An rêngin tirko an ni vawng am a nih? An rêngin thuhriltu an ni vawng am a nih? An rêngin inchûktirtu an ni vawng am a nih? An rêngin thilmak thawtu an ni vawng am a nih?

en: have all gifts of healings? do all speak with tongues? do all interpret?
hmr: An rêngin sukdam theina thilpêk chu an nei vawng am a nih? An rêngin ṭawng hrietlohaiin an hril vawng am a nih? An rêngin thu an hrilfie vawng am a nih?

en: But desire earnestly the greater gifts. And moreover a most excellent way show I unto you.
hmr: Thilpêka ropuitakhai chu châk hle lem ro. Chun, tuhin kawng ṭha nâwk zuol inentir ka ti cheu.
